description: If passed by Durham councillors, the plans will see a further 299 homes built at Whitworth Park.
title: Spennymoor homes set to be approved despite objections
title_page: Spennymoor homes set to be approved despite objections - BBC News
maintext:
The expansion of a housing estate is set to be approved by councillors despite dozens of objections.
Barratt Homes wants to build a further 299 homes at its Whitworth Park estate in Spennymoor, County Durham.
The proposal has been recommended for approval ahead of a Durham County Council planning committee on Wednesday.
However, there have been 55 objections to the plan, with Spennymoor Town Council among the opponents.
It is located directly to the north of the recently constructed housing development, known as Burton Woods, at the north-western edge of the town.
Barratt Homes said: "One of the key benefits of the site is the sustainability of its location and its connectivity to Spennymoor.
"This will have tangible economic benefits as well as providing extensive open space, play areas and fitness opportunities for the community."
